reviewText: I thought that, as far as true stories go, this was one of the best.  How much you feel what Jim and Jennifer felt towards each other.  Here you have two young people, newly married with a newborn infant, who are so much in love.  Jim is in the army and barely makes ends meet when catastrophy strikes.  His grandmother dies in Idaho.  Jim takes leave, they borrow Jennifer's brother's truck and head up into the mountains to attend the funeral. But, they get detoured and end up stranded in the wild life preserve for 10 days.  They see their baby dieing before their eyes and feel hopeless.  Jim, seeing they have no time left, leaves his wife and child in a cave and attempts to walk the 80 miles to get help.  How nice it is to see just how many miles love can take you.  Very good tv movie!!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Saw this movie on tv years ago and was glad it was available on DVD... This was based on a real life experience by the Stolpa family and Jim does everything in his power to save his wife and infant son after they disappeared in a blizzard...  Very good movie..
summary: Do what you have to; to survive

reviewText: I love this show when I first seen it, It only goes to show that we can do most anything possible. More true life stories and survival are a must to give everyone hope if they are in trouble and courage as protrayed in this movie as these people were Thank You for this movie as it is a credit by the director and performace by the actors
